discovered: UI has never been rendered in browser

Kanban dnd-kit imported but not wired up
Need a real name
sessions.next_session_suggestion: Boot the UI, fix everything broken, then use the tool to manage its own next iteration.
sessions.handoff_message: Built 79 files from scratch. Server boots clean. Everything needs browser testing.

sessions.objective: First boot — get dev-track running and validate UI rendering

shipped.title: All 11 UI views confirmed rendering in Chrome
GitHub repo created and code pushed

discovered: Cursor built-in browser doesn't work well with Vite/WebSocket
AI did not follow dev-track cursor rule proactively
Codebase scanner was scanning parent directory
sessions.next_session_suggestion: Test cold-start rule in fresh chat. Fix TypeScript build. Start dogfooding on Pillar.
sessions.handoff_message: UI works. GitHub repo live. ISS-001 resolved. Cold-start added to cursor rule.

sessions.objective: Full audit, fix core issues, build codebase visualizer, establish AI discipline

shipped.title: Archive/completed sections with reopen for Backlog + Issues
GitHub integration rewritten — zero config via local git + gh CLI
Cursor rule redesigned with inline briefing (no cold-start reads)
Standing Instructions section for cross-platform preferences
Interactive codebase visualizer with react-flow + dagre
Custom graph nodes, edges, detail panel with layman descriptions
Scanner rewritten for generic project structures (not Next.js-specific)
Mandatory post-change checklist added to cursor rule with alwaysApply frontmatter
Comprehensive session wrap-up — first proper dogfooding of session-end flow

discovered: AI context drift is a fundamental problem — passive instructions in cursor rules are unreliable for enforcing behavior (ISS-006)
Cursor rule had no frontmatter — may not have been loading at all
Scanner inferModules was hardcoded for Next.js — lumped everything into 'other' for non-Next projects
Architecture graph is technically accurate but semantically empty for non-developers (ISS-007)
The real fix for AI discipline is separation of concerns: background AI watcher for tracking, coding AI for coding (IDEA-014)
User preference: they want the tool to be AI-driven and self-managing, not human-prompted
The session-end flow had never been properly executed until now
sessions.next_session_suggestion: Make the architecture graph actually useful for laymen (ISS-007). Then test one real integration (GitHub is already zero-config — try Vercel or Supabase). Then seriously consider building the background AI watcher (IDEA-014) as it solves the core reliability problem.
sessions.handoff_message: Session 3 was the biggest yet — 11 items, 32 points. Major features: codebase visualizer (react-flow), zero-config GitHub integration, cursor rule overhaul. But the most important discovery was architectural: the AI doesn't reliably follow tracking rules, and adding more rules doesn't fix it. The solution is structural enforcement — either tool-level validation or a second AI dedicated to tracking. This is documented as ISS-006 (high severity), IDEA-014 (background AI watcher), and BN-009 (brain note). The cursor rule now has proper alwaysApply frontmatter and a mandatory checklist at the very top. Now items: test-integrations (pending), graph-layman-descriptions (new, pending). 4 open issues, 15 ideas captured. Dev servers running on ports 24680 (API) and 24682 (UI).

sessions.objective: Build AI-in-the-loop foundation — chat-first architecture with multi-provider routing

shipped.title: Plain-English module descriptions for graph (ISS-007 resolved)
Rich module detail panel with descriptions and connections
Docs view overhaul — markdown rendering, ToC, wiki layout
AI foundation: AIService across OpenAI/Anthropic/Google + Helicone
ChatService with multi-turn agent loop + SSE streaming
User profile + AI config + feature flags + budget controls

discovered: Anthropic model IDs change frequently — hardcoding breaks routing. Solution: auto-discover from APIs, classify by pattern
Helicone BYOK requires provider keys configured in Helicone dashboard, not just in our code
Hono SSE streaming works but both message_complete and done events fire — causes duplicate messages (ISS-008, fixed)
Dashboard brain note cards show stale/superseded notes (ISS-009, open)
The dev-track chat agent gave itself a remarkably accurate self-assessment — but 20% stale due to context loading only last 5 brain notes
Business model crystallized: NOT open source. Paid product: local daemon + web platform. Previous open-source decision superseded.
Chat-first is the right architecture — the chat IS the product, everything else is tools the chat calls
User captures ideas faster than any tracking system can keep up — needs automated capture or will always do manual audits
sessions.next_session_suggestion: 1. Test the chat agent in real conversations — verify tool calls work, fix any issues. 2. Build Settings UI for AI config (keys, models, flags). 3. Start dogfooding on Pillar — run dev-track init on Pillar, use chat for planning. 4. Begin background monitoring (ai-watcher) — the key missing piece for self-tracking.
sessions.handoff_message: Session 4 was the AI session. Built the entire intelligence layer: 3-provider AIService, auto-discovering ModelRouter (58 models from OpenAI/Anthropic/Google), 25-tool registry, ChatService with multi-turn agent loop, SSE streaming API, and persistent resizable chat sidebar. Also shipped graph layman descriptions (ISS-007 resolved) and docs wiki overhaul. Fixed model routing (auto-discovery vs hardcoded IDs) and duplicate message bug (ISS-008). Business model decided: paid product, not open source (BN-013). 23 ideas captured (IDEA-001 through IDEA-023). 3 open issues (ISS-003 integrations, ISS-004 DnD, ISS-006 AI drift — ISS-009 dashboard cards also open). Key insight: the chat giving its own self-assessment that was 80% right but 20% stale IS the problem dev-track exists to solve. v0.1 goal: dogfood on Pillar. Next: polish chat, Settings UI, start background monitoring.
